decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would be within two metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse, and the height of the eaves of the enlarged part would exceed 3 metres. The proposal would therefore not be within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, A.1 (i) and (ja) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended.

Reason : 2 - The enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would have more than a single storey and extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 3 metres. The proposal would therefore not be within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, A.1 (h)(i) and (ja) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended.

Reason : 3 - The total enlargement would have more than a single storey and, extend beyond an original side wall and exceed more than half the width of the original dwelling. The proposal would not be within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, A.1(j) (ii) (iii) and (ja) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended.
description: Single Storey Rear Extension: 6.00 metres deep, 3.00 metres maximum height, 3.00 metres high to the eaves
